STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
March 1, 2024
STEPHANIE A DETTLOFF
CHILD & FAMILY SERVICES - NORTHEAST MICHIGAN
1044 US HIGHWAY 23 N,
ALPENA, MI, 49707-1250
Re: License #: CB040201041
Dear STEPHANIE A DETTLOFF:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
2/12/2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (2) An agency shall complete written service plans
for each child and parent or parents, as follows:
• (b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial
removal and at least once every 90
calendar days thereafter.
One of the three foster child records reviewed contained at least one updated
service plan that was not completed withing the time frame established by this rule.
In this example the updated service plans with time periods ending 12/26/2022,
6/24/2023, and 9/22/2023 were completed 1/6/2023, 7/11/2023, and 11/9/2023
respectively. This is a repeat noncompliance from the renewal evaluation
completed 12/14/2022. CAP approval 1/13/2023.
CPA Rule 400.12421 Visitation and family time; in person contact
• (2) An agency social service worker shall visit the
foster child, and the foster parent, if applicable, in
the child's placement at least once every month.
One of the three foster child records reviewed did not include documentation that a
worker completed a monthly visit to the placement home of the foster child for the
month of June 2023.
2

CPA Rule 400.12405 Change of placement
• (4) If an emergency change in placement is
necessary, then all the documentation required in
subrules (2) and (3) of this rule must be in the
child's record within 14 calendar days after the
change in placement.
One of the three foster child records reviewed indicated the youth had a change in
placement effective 12/01/2023, but the required documentation for this change in
placement was completed 2/13/2024. This documentation needed to be completed
by 12/15/2023 for compliance with this rule.
FOM 722-06 B Family Team Meeting
The DHS-1105, Family Team Meeting Report, is used to
capture family demographics, FTM logistical information,
needs, strengths, action steps, safety concerns and the
safety plan, and any recommendations made for the
family during the FTM. The DHS-1105, Family Team
Meeting Report, must be completed for every FTM.
Three of the three foster child records reviewed included at least one Family Team
Meeting (FTM) that was not completed or documented as required by this standard.
The first example did not indicate an FTM was completed as required for the time
period ending 6/24/2023. The second example identified the completion of FTM's
11/9/2023 and 1/16/2024 that did not include the documentation of these FTM's with
the completion of an 1105 document. This is a repeat noncompliance from the
renewal evaluation completed 12/14/2022. CAP approval 1/13/2023.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical assistance related to certification and foster care information
documentation in the current information systems was provided.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• The agency did not require any consultation at this time.
3

VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. The
agency submitted a corrective action plan for the renewal evaluation completed
12/14/2022. Areas identified in noncompliance as a part of that review were Rules
327(1)(d), 327 (6)(b)(c), 327(7), and 418(2)(b). Noncompliance with FOM 722-06
B was also identified. The CAP for these areas of noncompliance was approved
1/13/23. The areas identified as repeat noncompliance as a part of this interim
evaluation were Rule 418(2))(b) and FOM 722-06 B. The agency also had one
special investigation that required a corrective action plan for noncompliance with
Rule 607. This CAP was approved 12/07/2023 with completion identified for
6/07/2024. This was not identified in noncompliance as a part of this interim
evaluation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment included a review of the agency's compliance
with corrective action plan requirements and key performance indicators.
Financial Overview
The most recent financial audit completed indicated the agency has sufficient
financial resources to provide appropriate services to children and families.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews did not identify any concerns regarding the provision of
appropriate services.
Youth interviews with the analyst indicated appropriate support services are being
provided.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency walk through indicated the record storage of files/information is
consistent with compliance with licensing rules.
4

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Analyst did not identify any safety concerns. Interviews with caregivers and youth
indicated appropriate support services are being provided.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
2/15/2024
________________________________________
Mark Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
3/1/2024
